alert.note: Alert for Imperial (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued October 06 at 3:03PM PDT until October 06 at 4:00PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Central Imperial County in southeastern California... * Until 400 PM PDT. * At 303 PM PDT, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 11 miles southwest of Cibola to 9 miles northwest of Algodones Dunes to 9 miles southwest of Gordon's Well to 24 miles southwest of San Luis, moving west at 40 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... CA Interstate 8 between mile markers 27 and 78. CA Route 78 between mile markers 14 and 68. CA Route 111 between mile markers 1 and 41. Locations impacted include... El Centro, Calexico, Brawley, Imperial, Holtville, Westmorland, Gordon's Well, Mt. Signal, El Centro Naval Airfield, Calipatria, Slab City, Alamorio, Seeley, Wiest and Bonds Corner. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
